name: Mercure Bratislava Centrum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mercure is very convenient to the railway station, but not to the historic old city. This is a brisk 15 minute walk away. Perfectly acceptable during the day, but a bit annoying at night, as there are no decent restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel.
reviews.title: Perhaps not 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were OK. Beds excellent - firm but comfortable. Bathrooms were well apponteed. Temperature of room was not OK. Far too warm, with an unmanageable AC control. We left the windows open, as our room opened onto an interior courtyard and was therefore not noisy. Even then, it was very warm overnight.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but double check your booking

reviews.text: Service was questionable. We returned to our room at 4.30 pm on our second day there and it still had not been made up. When we queried this, we were told that the cleaners "worked to a schedule". Have not known of a 4 star hotel where rooms were still unserviced at 4pm. More to the point, the desk staff made us feel as if we were unreasonable expecting a clean room at 4 pm. The following day, the cleaning staff let themselves into our room twice while we were still in the room, without excusing themselves.
reviews.title: Great hotel close to main train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was good, offering a lot of variety, but watch out for the clumps of salt in the omelettes.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is convenient for the train station as you can see it accross the road. If you fly the Bratislava you can then get the number 61 bus from the airport that drops you at the train station. The rooms and the inside of the hotel are beautifully presented and the staff are helpful and courteous. There was a good selection for the buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I am staying in Mercury Bratislava regularly for about 2 years and always this has been a pleasant experience. It is a nice hotel, newly done, in fresh modern style. Rooms are really cool looking, in a kind of design / pop art style. service is good, no problems.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Bratislava, suitable for business stay

reviews.text: This is the only review which I have given a `5' rating to.
reviews.title: Excellent - by far the best on my Europe trip

reviews.text: My just concluded Europe holiday covered 14 hotels in 27 days. The hotels were expected to in roughly the same class (see my other reviews), but this one was by far the best. I think these 2 comments speak for themselves.
reviews.title: Far from old town but excellent

reviews.text: The location is fairly central. Next to the rail station and while not quite next to the old town, Bratislava is small enough for that not to matter - besides, its a pleasant walk !
reviews.title: Well appointed hotel with excellent decor and service.

reviews.text: The room was large, well designed and very comfortable. I appreciated the A/c and high speed internet (compared to other properties on my trip).
reviews.title: Thank you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was outstanding in several aspects:
reviews.title: Amazing experience
Excellent hotel with very helpful staff

reviews.text: - modern design rooms, very comfortable as well
reviews.title: Best of bests
Enjoy my stay in Bratislava
reviews.text: - really welcoming, friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a shame that we could only enjoy the quality of this hotel for one night as we were in Bratislava for just one night as a stop over between Budapest and Vienna. Of all the places we stayed on our holiday the Mercure was the most luxurious and whilst geared up primarily as a business hotel the place was perfect for our needs.
reviews.title: Funky rooms in a modern business hotel

reviews.text: As you can see from the pictures already posted, the rooms are decked out in funky designs with an arty and breezy feel to them. The room was of good size, impeccably clean and with a spacious bathroom (incuding see through wall seperator!! - not good if you are staying with a mate!).
reviews.title: Quality hotel, area less ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the little we saw, the staff all seemed very pleasant and professional. - typical Mercure standards.
reviews.title: Very good hotel fairly central

reviews.text: The breakfast served was outstanding and the best we had all holiday with an array of beautifully cooked and varied foods. Went back for more and more and more!
reviews.title: Perfect if you are traveling by train

reviews.text: The price we paid for the one night (£52) was an absolute bargain and largely indicative of the cheap prices in Bratislava, a town rapdily heading towards modernisation.
reviews.title: The hotel with the best quality / price ratio in Bratislava

description: New 4 star Bratislava hotel features 175 uniquely designed rooms. The hotel is located in the city center within 10 minutes walk from the Bratislava castle and the downtown pedestrian shopping area. Near business centers and tourist attractions, this hotel will meet your expectations. Chill out and bar area for well-being. Coffee and tea facilities in all rooms, Wifi, fitness and Privilege lounge. Meals and drinks available 24/7. The hotel offers 7 meeting rooms (max. capacity 180 pax).
